page.title: 15Grantham: Parascending.
page.content: Parascending is artificial parachuting which involves being towed by a jeep and being cut loose when you have reached a suitable height.The parachute is open before you start and as you run behind the jeep the force of the wind takes you up.You are then pulled through the air by the rope and you stay in the air for up to 5 minutes. Parascending in Grantham is done at the Prince William of Gloucester Barracks. The organisations which participate are the scouting movement, the services, the cadets,the police and any others brave enough to join in this daring sport. The instruction is given privately and costs in the region of Â£30 for the necessary lessons,parachute,petrol and jeep.The minimum age is generally 16.
